page.title: 02BODFARI SCHOOL POPULATION
page.content: Ysgol Bodfari is a small bilingual rural school.There are sixty full time pupils and eight pupils in the school's part time nursery.It is interesting to note that only 54% of the children come from the Bodfari area,the remaining children coming from the surrounding villages of Llandyrnog (12%),Tremeirchion (7%), Afonwen (3%) and from the town of Denbigh (22%) which is four miles away. With so many children living outside the village it is not surprising that only one in ten of the children walk to school.In fact 26% of the children living in the area need a taxi to come to school because they live in the farms and small holdings dotted around the village.
